items.title: ‘Perverse’ Incentives: How Local Governments Might Cash In on Trump’s Migrant Detention
items.description: Some local officials see President-elect Donald Trump’s promise of mass deportations as an answer to their budget woes.

items.title: While Youth Detention Numbers Rise, States Begin to Roll Back Reforms
items.description: Los Angeles County is one of many places that have struggled to maintain safe conditions for youth and seen reform efforts stall or be abandoned.

items.title: Cops Took My Christmas Bike. Now I Give Kids the Freedom To Ride.
items.description: For formerly incarcerated activist Dorsey Nunn, the most wonderful time of the year is a holiday bicycle giveaway for kids with parents in prison.

items.title: Relief Coming to Ohio Drivers Suspended Over Lack of Money
items.description: A Marshall Project and News 5 investigation inspired a bipartisan bill to address the license suspension crisis affecting hundreds of thousands of Ohi...

items.title: How a 1963 Cleveland Case Shaped Stop-and-Frisk Police Tactics, and Why It Still Matters
items.description: Under Cleveland’s consent decree, police have to track each stop.
